The late glacial events in Wales are known as the Devensian Glaciation that peaked about 20Ka. </summary> <dc:date>2011-04-28T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Vulnerability and adaptive capacity of biodiversity in Wales</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/7184" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Walmsley, Clive</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/7184</id> <updated>2014-10-23T02:52:04Z</updated> <published>2011-04-27T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Vulnerability and adaptive capacity of biodiversity in Wales Walmsley, Clive Presented at C3W climate change research review and workshop event on 27th April 2011, Aberystwyth University. </summary> <dc:date>2011-04-27T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Climate Modelling Research and Applications in Wales</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/2160/7164" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Houghton, John</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/2160/7164</id> <updated>2014-10-23T02:52:00Z</updated> <published>2011-04-26T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Climate Modelling Research and Applications in Wales Houghton, John Computer modelling of the atmosphere and climate system has revolutionised weather forecasting and research and climate prediction. </summary> <dc:date>2011-04-26T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> </feed>
